panels.description: L1 batch number per stage - from being `sealed` in `state_keeper` to `l1_mined_ExecuteBlocks` in `eth_sender`. Delay in proof l1 operation is commonly observed when there are issues with provers, while a delay in commit operation is indicative of problems with `eth_sender`
panels.title: L1 Batch Height

panels.description: Transactions per second: how many are added to mempool and how many are executed in the state keeper.
panels.title: TPS - 4h rolling average

panels.description: Number of requests per second our API servers serve
panels.title: RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description:
The 24-hour difference between committing a block and executing it On chain.
If two lines cross and Execute line below Commit, that means we delayed withdrawals for more  then 24hrs
panels.title: Execution Delay

panels.description: Number of transactions rejected in State Keeper. They waste the Sequencer resources without paying fee, so high number of them is indicative of a bug or a DoS attack
panels.title: Transactions rejected in State Keeper

panels.description: Number of priority/L1 transactions added and executed per second
panels.title: Priority transactions TPS

panels.description: Number of API requests handled per second - colors represent different methods
panels.title: API RPS per method

panels.description: Api response time as measured from API servers themselves. p999, p99 and p9 values. All methods are weighted equally, so this might not be a good representation of user experience
panels.title: Api response time - percentiles

panels.description: Api response time as measured from Nginx. p999, p99 and p9 values. All methods are weighted equally, so this might not be a good representation of user experience
panels.title: Api response time - latency (nginx)
